insights: President Trump's executive order on March 27th made DC safe and beautiful again by removing over 70 homeless camps and enforcing laws against graffiti on monuments.
The US Park Police are responsible for enforcing laws in federal park properties, including the National Mall, and have been working to clean up the area and make it safe for visitors.
The DC National Guard will be operationalized by the Secretary of the Army and will be deployed to the streets of Washington in the coming week to support law enforcement efforts.
The President is working with ICE and CBP to protect the city and ensure that it is safe for visitors, and is committed to supporting law enforcement and the National Guard in their efforts.

The administration is taking a comprehensive approach to addressing crime in DC, including working with the FBI, ATF, and US Attorney's office to identify and prosecute criminals and make the city safe again.
The President is committed to making DC beautiful and safe again, and is working with law enforcement and other agencies to achieve this goal.
